bibl.title: Compositional Patterns in PGM IV (= P. Bibl. Nat. Suppl. gr. no. 574).
bibl.note: P.G.M. I, IV. Examines thematic and papyrological features of the manuscript, which both converge with and deviate from each other in ways often suggestive of pre-existing sub-formularies.
bibl.seg: LiDONNICI Lynn R., Compositional Patterns in PGM IV (= P. Bibl. Nat. Suppl. gr. no. 574).
P.G.M. I, IV. Examines thematic and papyrological features of the manuscript, which both converge with and deviate from each other in ways often suggestive of pre-existing sub-formularies.
